page.title: 14River Chater in Leighfield
page.content: The River Chater from Launde to Leigh Lodge is one of the few unimproved watercourses in Leicestershire, retaining a characteristically meandering course with pools interspersed by riffles. Below the fishponds a steep scarp slope to the south supports a rich spring fed marsh now designated a Site of Special Scientific Interest. Plants here include great horsetail, marsh marigold, wood clubrush, spotted orchid and fleabane, all now uncommon in Leicestershire. Further downstream the watercourse has preserved from cultivation a series of small patches of marsh,rough grassland and scrub which are some of the richest areas of wildlife habitat in Rutland.Blackcaps, garden warblers and willow warblers nest here and butterflies include skippers,gatekeepers and ringlets.
